content:
While working on an issue, I found that the current design of the topic list in the left sidebar topics has some space between them where the cursor is not pointing at any topic.

I don't think this is intentional and could be fixed by some redistribution of padding.

1090-design-Zulip-Community-Zulip-Brave-2022-12-02-19-11-18.mp4
You are right about it. The new design implementation should fix that.

I think this was actually an intentional decision. I don't know what's best but here's a few interaction details that motivated this:

  • In the right sidebar, when you hover over a user row, we display a tooltip with extra details. Those tooltips can feel awkward when you're hovering the space between rows.
  • It can be more annoying for a misclick on the boundary between rows to take you to the wrong view than to do nothing.
I don't see any value in those tooltips actually
They are potentially useful when the topic name doesn't fit.
I meant in the right sidebar, they just showing the name of the person and the status which is already there

Yeah we should rethink the right sidebar tooltips; they predated having a way to see the status text not on hover. I think they can show when the user was last present in more detail, and that'd be useful and justify them existing I think.

I think they can show when the user was last present in more detail, and that'd be useful and justify them existing I think.

I'm confused -- they already do that.

they predated having a way to see the status text not on hover

Note that this is a personal display setting, so not everyone sees the status text.
Even if it is hidden, as default here (?), they also show long names/status if the end of that is hidden.
I suppose it could show more up to date timing of when last online, for active/idle users?
Yeah, you can mostly ignore my last message; was a bit distracted.
